column5: Does any one use the back roads map book? I know a new one just came out. Is it as detailed as the describe, I have read their testimonials and looked at the sample. Just wondering if any of you use them

I have two GPS's set up with the Backroads maps. One unit is probably 4-5 years old, the other one was new as of this time last year (wife's Christmas present). I don't know if there have been any updates on the Ontario Backroads map since last year. You should know going in, that some of the roads/trails shown on the map may not be passable, meaning so grown up a 4-wheeler can't get through, maybe culverts/bridges have been removed, or the trail may be washed out, I have seen all of that, a lot. The canoe routes are the same story, most have not been maintained in our area, don't know about elsewhere. With that said, it is a very good tool for our purposes.
I did not know this existed. What is the name and the publisher. I am interested. Thank you!!
That's what I'm looking at purchasing just wanting your guys opions
Sorry, I have never used them. I just looked up the link for the previous poster.
I use my backroad map book all the time. It is very useful tool in the bush. But like skywagon said, not all roads are passable. I don't know a better map for the bush
